seo.title: Day trip to Capri from Positano
seo.description: How to plan a day trip to Capri: ferries, timing, and must-see areas.

linkLabel: Day trip to Capri from Positano
intro: Capri in a day from Positano: start early, pack light, and plan a loop that balances Anacapri views with an easy return.

sections.title: Morning — arrival & Anacapri
body: Catch the first ferry so you land before cruise-day crowds, then bus up to Anacapri and ride the chairlift to Monte Solaro if heights excite you.
Grab a simple breakfast in Piazza Vittoria and buy your return ferry ticket straight away to lock in your departure time.

sections.title: Midday — Marina Piccola loop
body: Walk or bus down towards Marina Piccola for a swim or photo stop; carry reef-safe sunscreen and at least 1 litre (34 oz) of water per person.
Pick up panini or salad boxes from a deli instead of lingering lunches so you can climb back up without rushing.

sections.title: Afternoon — Capri town & return
body: Ride the funicular to Capri town for Via Camerelle, the Giardini di Augusto, and a final gelato or espresso break.
Be at Marina Grande at least 30 minutes before departure in case there’s a queue for the funicular or baggage drop.

sections.title: Getting to and from Capri
body: Use the %HOWTO:positano-capri-ferry|Positano → Capri ferry guide% for the outbound crossing and the %HOWTO:capri-positano-ferry|Capri → Positano ferry guide% on your return.

steps.name: Check seasonal ferries
steps.text: Confirm morning departures and last returns to Positano.

steps.name: Arrive early at the pier
steps.text: Queue 20–30 minutes before departure in peak season.

steps.name: Plan your route on Capri
steps.text: Prioritise Anacapri or Marina Grande + viewpoints depending on time.

tips: Buy outbound and return ferry tickets together so you can adjust your route without scrambling for seats later in the day.
Carry a small daypack with water, sunscreen, and cash — ATMs on Capri can run dry during peak weeks.
Download offline maps for Capri and bus timetables; signal drops around Anacapri and the Blue Grotto queue.
warnings: Chairlift and funicular queues surge after 15:00; miss your slot and you risk a standby ferry return.
Rough seas can cancel late sailings without notice — check morning bulletins and have a Sorrento connection as backup.
Blue Grotto closures are common in wind or swell; operators may still sell tickets, so confirm it is operating before you join the line.

faqs.q: Can I include the Blue Grotto?
a: Only if it’s your priority—expect a shuttle boat and 60–90 minutes of waiting, which squeezes the rest of the itinerary.

faqs.q: Do I need to prebook tickets?
a: Reserve morning ferries in high season and consider buying chairlift or boat tour slots online; shoulder-season travellers can usually buy on the spot.
